body.name: HITHIM 4-Tier Shoe Rack,Stackable Wide Shoe Shelf for Shoe Storage,Sturdy Shoe Stand,Non-Woven Fabric Long Shoe Organizer for Closet,Upgrade Shoe Holder for Entryway, Doorway and Bedroom
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 22 hrs 5 mins
features: EASIER INSTALLATION-The cubby shoe rack has upgraded the structure of metal tube and replaced the plastic links with threaded splicing, which makes the installation more convenient and simple than others shoe shelf and will save you a lot of time.

STURDY CONSTRUCTION-The shoe rack adopts a more compact design to ensure its stability, thickened metal steel pipe and updated non-woven fabric make the shoe cabinet stronger,and it also ensures the quality,allowing you to say goodbye to cheap and low-quality shoe racks.

STACKABLE DESIGN-The closet shoe organizer adopts stackable tenon joint design. This stackable shoe rack reduces the use of floor space and is ideal for a variety of places. You can order two 4-tier shoe racks, you can stack the black shoe self to a 8-tier shoe rack，as an entry shoe rack or closet shoe rack, or front door shoes.

UPGRADE MATERIAL-The shoe organizer is made of high-quality metal and durable non-woven fabric that is easy to clean, but also dust-proof, waterproof and oil-proof. The shoe stand would be better for your shoe organizers and storage.

INCREASED HEIGHT - The single-layer height of the shoe holder is increased by 7.8 inches, which is more suitable for high heels and short boots. You can also store boots by adjusting the layers of the shoe rack. This shoe storage organizer can better help you with storage problem!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Connect 1 and 2 and twist them in! You will get a long tube! Thread the non-woven fabric through the extended metal tube! Use all your strength to squeeze to ensure that the plastic part and the metal tube are completely connected！ When installing each layer, press firmly to ensure that the metal pipes and plastic parts are installed properly.

The detail of HITHIM shoe rack 1. The height is changed from 6" to 8", suitable for more types of shoes; 2. Thickened metal tube, longer service life; 3. The splicing method is simpler and safer; saves time; 4. Non-woven material, dustproof and waterproof, more suitable for your shoes.
Install Tips If you find during installation that two pipes do not match, you can try replacing one of them!Please be sure to keep the metal pipe and plastic parts tightly connected!

What is the material of this shoe rack? Thickened metal tubes, non-woven fabrics and plastic parts What's different about this shoe rack? Ultra-extended and installed in a different way How to protect the shoe rack to make it last longer? Avoid wind and sun, and don't put items that exceed its load-bearing capacity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly like the picture
reviews.reviewText: Easy assemble. Con a little light weighted.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Bigger than I thought, a plus. Easy to put together...just put on some music and in 1/2 hour you've got a rack for your things. It is better than I expected.\\

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This shoe rack is nice. Now it is a mesh net,but it is sturdy and I don't believe it can be easily ripped. My 17yo and 8yo assembled it in about 20 minutes. The poles could be stronger..they just feel light. It holds a decent amount of my 17yo sons sneakers. Nice quality shoe rack for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Perfect. The right size, inexpensive, relatively easy to assemble. Have a small rubber mallet handy, since you will need it to secure the pieces with a good whack. The kit does not supply one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars AMAZON is going downhill with their products !
reviews.reviewText: Cheaply made , got 2 #1 pipes packages . Should have gotten 1 #1 and 1 #2 package .#1 pipe goes into #2 pipe to make shelves for shoes. There are 10 shelves.Do they check what is being put in the boxes.So frustrating and disappointing. AMAZON has been going down hill with with their products. I ordered wooden dominos for my grand kids and they recieved cracked painted pieces of wood that cracked in half in their hands. Hello splinters in kids hands. It was such garbage!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE IT
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely pleased with the HITHIM 5-Tier Shoe Rack! This shoe rack is a game-changer for keeping my footwear organized and easily accessible. The stackable and wide design provides ample space for storing a variety of shoes, making it a practical and efficient storage solution.The non-woven fabric material adds a touch of sophistication, and the sturdy construction ensures the durability of the shoe rack. Assembly was a breeze, and the stackable feature allows for customization based on the number of shoes and available space.The wide shelves are ideal for accommodating different shoe sizes and styles, from heels to sneakers. The open design makes it easy to spot and grab the pair I need, saving time and eliminating the frustration of searching for matching shoes.Whether placed in the closet, entryway, or bedroom, the HITHIM 5-Tier Shoe Rack is a versatile and space-saving addition to any home. It brings order to shoe chaos and enhances the overall tidiness of living spaces. Highly recommend for anyone in need of an efficient and stylish shoe storage solution!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Moderately Simple Construction, Rigid Once Tight and Complete
reviews.reviewText: Like many of these inexpensive shelves/racks, the materials are all thin metals and plastics. This isn't necessarily a bad thing given it keeps the rack extremely lightweight and makes the construction fairly simple. All of the pieces simply insert or twist, there is no hardware. With that said they all fit together quite tight, and once all together result in a nice and rigid shoe rack. The included wooden mallet (while extremely cheaply made) is nice to have handy as the majority of the pieces do need to be "tapped" together with the mallet. I would recommend using the included mallet, as something heavy in your existing toolbox may break some of the plastic pieces whereas the wooden mallet applies just enough pressure to fit together without the risk of chipping or breaking anything.One small piece of advice, for the horizontal bars that create the surface of the shelving, they are two pieces that insert and then screw together. There are 20 horizontal bars to "build" for me, 90% when together very smooth and required nearly no "elbow grease." Two did not. Easy fix: if they start to not come together smooth and begin to cross-thread, just swap the male and female ends with alternate pieces and they will go together likely without any hassle at all. No need to force them together, another pairing will work well.Ultimately, moderately simple construction, just enough force needed to get it to come together and the result is a rigid, inexpensive, and functional shoe rack.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Holds a LOT of shoes!
reviews.reviewText: Where to begin with this shoe rack? First of all, it comes with a mallet that looks like it was carved by a medieval woodworker who time-traveled it forward to December of 2023 solely for me to pound in black plastic rods into holes of a shelf that will hold my family's plethora of shoes. The next thing you need to know that that it was actually pretty easy to assemble, so you actually won't even need the time-traveled wooden mallet. The instructions were simple. The shoes are ultimately going to sit on thin, cheap fabric that you pull horizonal rods through. This was unexpected, but actually fine because it made this shelf lightweight and easy to move around, in addition to holding more shoes than I ever imagined!Overall, if you are looking for an inexpensive and lightweight shoe shelf, this product is something I would definitely recommend.
